storyInfo: Texas wakes up from a dream, knowing that her past has come knocking on her door. Dark clouds loom over Volsinii; the rainy season has come.

attributes.content: The streets of Columbia, as a whole, are generally more spacious and vibrant than those of Siracusa.
But when walking through these streets, one sometimes feels a sense of emptiness, as if one does not belong.
Hey you, carwash guy. Heard you're from Siracusa, so I got a question for you.
attributes.name: Frivolous Columbian

attributes.content: I'm here to wash cars, not answer questions.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: Don't be like that, pal.
attributes.name: Frivolous Columbian

attributes.content: Relax, we're not here to cause trouble for broke-ass bumpkins like you.
attributes.name: Frivolous Columbian

attributes.content: Heard a group of your countrymen came into town today, and we just wanna know where they are.
attributes.name: Frivolous Columbian

attributes.content: What business do you have with them?
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: Business? Uhh... catching up on old times?
attributes.name: Frivolous Columbian

attributes.content: Old times, huh.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: Hey, my nonno always used to tell me, 'never forget that you're Siracusan.'
attributes.name: Frivolous Columbian

attributes.content: You don't look 'Siracusan' to me.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: Me? Siracusan? Hah!
attributes.name: Frivolous Columbian

attributes.content: Columbia is the future, pal! It's where the gold certificates are!
attributes.name: Frivolous Columbian

attributes.content: The young associates of the Columbian families always heard from their forefathers that they came from Siracusa.
But they've never taken it seriously.
Your roots will always be in Siracusa.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: It's the crusty old fossils who say stuff like that.
attributes.name: Cheerful Columbian

attributes.content: Columbia is a land of pioneers! Roots? We don't need roots.
attributes.name: Cheerful Columbian

attributes.content: That's right, hick. You'd better tell us where your paesani are, if you don't want any 'accidents' happening to your little shop here.
attributes.name: Frivolous Columbian

attributes.content: They're in that bar across the street.
attributes.name: Carwash Worker

attributes.content: You got a good head on your shoulders, pal. Don't see a whole lotta wolf pups out there as bright as you.
attributes.name: Cheerful Columbian

attributes.content: To be a pioneer is to invite chaos, and the Columbian families gradually lost the order they should've had amidst this chaos.
But for Siracusa, order stands taller than the law itself.
The carwash worker zones out their noise and commotion, turning and slowly opening a cabinet to produce a tool that he is all too familiar with.
It is heavy and sharp, having been meticulously polished by the carwash worker. The glint reflecting off its blade reminds one of the moonlight in Siracusa.
Then, he slowly walks toward the complacent idiots who have their backs turned to him.
Like a carwash worker who only wants to scrub the floors before opening up shop.
Like a Siracusan.
Texas's eyes snap wide open.
As her vision comes into focus in the darkness, she sees a poster Exusiai put up against her will.
Her hands transmit to her the sensation of the down quilt that Croissant sold to her at a special price when the season changed.
Sora's sleep-assisting CD is still playing.
All of this lets her breathe a sigh of relief.
She understands full well that the dream had never really happened, that the Columbian family never had a chance to pester the Siracusan guest.
As for the carwash worker, she has only met him once.
A dream that has no meaning except to remind her of her Siracusan roots.
Since coming to Lungmen, she hasn't had this dream in a long while.
So why have it now?
She unconsciously wants to see the night outside her window.
The moonlight still shines bright and clean.
Myriad colors still dot Lungmen's nightscape.
But within it all is an existence utterly incompatible with everything around it.
Outside her window, on a rooftop beneath the moon, a wolf is staring directly at her.
If everything surrounding it can be called the creations of civilization, then this wolf is undoubtedly a symbol of the wild wastes.
He does not belong here, and never should have appeared here.
But he still appeared in all his majesty, his figure seeming to tower above everything else around him.

attributes.text: Come. It is time for you to fulfill your end of the deal.

attributes.content: In an instant, Texas understands why she had the dream.
Dreams are not necessarily connected to reality.
But dreams often are omens.
And without a doubt, the dream she had tonight portendsâ€”
That her past has come knocking on her door.
Noisy. Excessive. Corrupt.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: How far you've fallen, to become indolent in a place like this.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: But, at least you thought of killing me the moment you saw me.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: That means my trip was still worthwhile.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: I can give it a serious try, Zaaro.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: It won't make a difference in the end. Same as seven years ago.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: You should feel grateful, last wolf of Famiglia Texas. Our deal still stands, which means you still have a chance to pay off your debt.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: The wastelands have always played fair.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Stop calling yourself the wastelands.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: It has never cut deals with anyone, 'Signore dei Lupi.'
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Heh. Maybe you've just never gotten close enough.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Stop talking in circles. What do you want me to do?
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Follow me back to Siracusa. You are to assist my Fang.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: ...'Fang.'
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Fulfill his request, and consider your debt paid in full.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: At that time, whether you choose to return here or remain there is no longer any of my concern.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Fine.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: If it ain't Zaaro, Lord of Wolves.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Think you can just show up in my city, take my people, leave like it ain't no thing?
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Your brain overgrown with weeds now too? Ah, my bad. Forgot, you ain't even got a brain.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Emperor, my wretched kin.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: How long has it been since we last met? Two hundred years? Three?
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: What is this revolting outfit of yours? What are you dressing up as?
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: What happened to your sheet music? Or your conductor's baton? Have you finally tired of pretentiously tickling the ivories atop the lofty spires of Leithanien?
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Mind your business, Zaaro. As if I'd remember when the last time we met was. Wish there wasn't a last time, hope there won't be a next time, and that I forget about this time.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: I don't understand. You can choose to step aside, and then forget all about it.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Did I stutter? Get your sorry ass back to Siracusa, and leave my people outta your shit.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: I don't even get how your brothers and sisters still let you and your pups play your little mob game in Siracusa.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: There are many paths to victory. This was my decision, and it has nothing to do with you.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Y'all had some kinda inside deal there, right?
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Like y'all keep to your own turf, keep outta human business.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Take a good look at yourself. You hardly look any different from the humans, and you're telling me to stay out of human affairs?
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: What are these toys of yours to the glaciers that have not melted for tens of thousands of years? What are these ridiculous black glasses of yours compared to the lasting darkness of the polar nights?
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: And then, there's your so-called 'music.' What need is there for music when you already have the coldest wind?
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Throw all of this away, Emperor.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: You are forgetting what you truly are. What 'we' truly are.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: You made up those rules. They ain't for me.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: My life ain't your business, wolfie.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: They came up with something new, I decided I liked it, and I made it mine. Simple as that.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: We've always belonged to the wasteland.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: You showed your ass callin' this land the 'wastes.' Ain't nothin' wasted here to me.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Think you're any different from the humans? Rollin' around the forests of Siracusa didn't get you all hungry for power. You never thought about where all that ambition came from?
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Zaaro, you ain't made no progress in millennia, and on top of that, you also picked up the dumbest shit humanity's got on offer.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: (Low snarl)
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Stow your fangs, kid. That's rude.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: There's no point fighting amongst ourselves. Nothing will come of it.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: I'm just a messenger, here to claim what's rightfully mine.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: She isn't even qualified to be my pawn yet.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: My people are more than qualified to do anything. Including guttin' you.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Your people?
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: She doesn't belong to you, Emperor.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Perhaps, you can ask her opinion.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Seven years ago, when I wanted out of Columbia, Zaaro struck a deal with me.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: I'd be allowed to go free, and in return, I would do him one favor, in the future.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Without this promise, I wouldn't have made it out of Columbia alive.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Ugh, I know all that. Point is, you gonna leave with him?
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Sorry, boss, but I have to honor my word.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: I don't give no shit about deals and words, Zaaro. She's my employee.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Texas, I could, magnanimous man that I am, give you some vacation time and let you sort through all your business. Got nothin' to do with me.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: I mean, Penguin Logistics employees are free, even if they're in Siracusa.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: And you, Zaaro, if you dare get up in her business, I'll show up at your stinkin' lair and rip the tail hairs outta you and every one of your siblings. Make myself a nice broom.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Hah.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Child of Texas, you may make preparations as you see fit, or say your goodbyes.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: No need. Sorry, boss, but I'm going to need a favor. Tell the girls I'm going to be gone for a while, but I'll be back soon.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: I'll just tell 'em you were cryin' about wanting to head back to Siracusa, and you took a long vacation. I tried to stop you, but you wouldn't take no for an answer.
attributes.name: Emperor

attributes.content: Then... I'll have to buy them some extra souvenirs, and apologize to them when I get back.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: If you have nothing to say, let's be off.
attributes.name: Zaaro

attributes.content: Fine.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: And so, a woman and a wolf walk westward, soon disappearing into the night.
The streetlights flicker on and off.
Volsinii Alleyway
*pant*... *pant*... Did I make it?
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: Heh, good question.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: When did youâ€”?!
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: You're pretty lucky. Right when took the shot, you bent over to pick up the keys that had fallen under the seat.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Wh-Who are you people? What did I ever do to you?!
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: 'Did I make it?' Hah! 'Did I make it?'
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Can you make it away from air and water? Can a Siracusan ever get away from the rainy season?
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Who could ever get away from them? Or well, from us?
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: What famiglia do you belong to? I've done everything right. No gambling, no debt. I'm just an ordinary clerk at il Ministero dei Lavori Pubblici!
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: Ohh, il Ministero dei Lavori Pubblici. That's a hot topic around Volsinii these days.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: I... I know the son of Don Bellone!
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: That's enough talking.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: (Now's my chance!)
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: Ugh, what a pain in the ass. A little trick won't save you.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: The rain's not letting up, huh.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Want a bite? After all, this is Siracusa, the land of pizza!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: I've ordered all the flavors the gourmet guide said were worth ordering!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: At least one of us is in a good mood.
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: You didn't forget why we came here, didja?
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Not like worrying about it's gonna do any good.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: We've been asking around. Those guys in the black suits don't ever say anything!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: All I heard is that some family by the name of Bellone recently welcomed a guest. I'm gonna head over and take a look around their place.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: That scene, though, tsk tsk. The fowlbeasts are probably gonna make a detour once they pass by.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Ain't that all the more reason to worry?
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Lemme tell you, our girl's from here. With her skills, she won't get into any big trouble.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Plus, we came here with the expectation that we might not see her face-to-face at all. Isn't that right, Sora?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Plays and operas are a very robust scene in Siracusa. Whether you're in a tavern or in a theater, there are always many performances to be found. Siracusans from all walks of life regard opera as a way to unwind.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: They say even the mobsters are no exception.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: So I thought, maybe if I could get into a troupe...
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Gotta hand it to ya, Sora, quick thinkin' there nabbin' this chance through Monster Siren Records.
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Coincidentally, my agent just asked if I was interested in going to Siracusa to develop my career, which I turned down because I didn't want to leave Lungmen.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: But even so, ain't Siracusan opera way different from yer usual style?
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: It sure is. Both the choreography and the singing will pose major challenges. Plus, we're also talking about a completely different kind of stage.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: But after seeing my performance, the director said he'd be willing to give me a shot.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Aha... If MSR didn't already have a contact ready to go, I would've had to keep waiting.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Are you sure I'm not gonna wake up to find you also disappeared without saying goodbye?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: That's not going to happen!
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: I'm not even brave enough for that.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Speakin' of which, ain't it time for your meetup with the troupe's artistic director?
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: You always had these meetings in some kinda company building or theater before. Crazy he wanted to meet ya in a restaurant like this.
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: That's not completely unheard of. Some people prefer to chat in a more natural, everyday setting to get a better feel for the actor.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: An everyday setting, huh.
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Poppin' up in Siracusa like this don't feel natural to me in the least. But, all I'n do is hope it goes well.
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: When we get back to Lungmen, Texas is payin' for three months of boba tea... No, make that six!
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Only six? We've got a chance to make her pay through the nose!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Wow, the director actually showed.
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: H-Help me!
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: Huh? What's going on?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Look out!
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Spectacular! I got some great shots from the rehearsal just now!
attributes.name: Theater Manager

attributes.content: How was it, Signor Bernardo?
attributes.name: Actress

attributes.content: Not bad.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Really?!
attributes.name: Actress

attributes.content: But, not good either.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: You're too eager to perform, Lena. It's as if you want ten critics to see twelve different emotions in one of your performances.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: But, that's too excessive for my needs.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Just give me one thing, as long as it's yours. Your own grief, your own passion, your own desolation.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: It's not easy being an actor. You are not a prop on the stage, Lena, and you should not settle for being a prop either.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: S-Si, signor!
attributes.name: Actress

attributes.content: Director, the guests from Lungmen have arrived.
attributes.name: Theater Manager

attributes.content: Very good.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Are you sure you need to meet with her personally though? She's just a small-time songstress from Lungmen. I can handle this myself.
attributes.name: Theater Manager

attributes.content: Loreno, I know that you, as Lena's uncle, have always sought to impede her potential competitors.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: But you could try to hide it a little better.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Wait... I'm not trying to hide anything from you at all. It's just that we don't have a particularly deep relationship with Monster Siren Records.
attributes.name: Theater Manager

attributes.content: Rather, there isn't a single theater troupe in Siracusa who thinks highly of this agency trying so desperately to wriggle into our market.
attributes.name: Theater Manager

attributes.content: But you went beyond expectations in agreeing to the deal to bring one of their singers over to study at our theater.
attributes.name: Theater Manager

attributes.content: Both logically and emotionally, this doesn't benefit us at all. And now you're even going to meet her, personally?
attributes.name: Theater Manager

attributes.content: It's as you said, Loreno. She is just a small-time songstress from Lungmen, with nothing inherently deserving of my attention.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: But, as you will soon see, the 'from Lungmen' part holds a special significance.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Are you talking about...?
attributes.name: Theater Manager

attributes.content: (*whispers*)
attributes.name: Bodyguard

attributes.content: Thank you. Tell him, don't go overboard.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: It's our life, isn't it?
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: These guys are actually using explosive bolts?!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Are you alright, sir?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: I-I'm fine, for now.
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: But you people... you're foreigners, right?
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: You shouldn't have helped me. Getting mixed up with those people is a good way to get killed.
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: Am I the only one who thinks it's mighty strange that there's a murder in broad daylight and nobody seems to care?!
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Grr, these guys are tougher to deal with than the gangsters back in Lungmen.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: You're only making trouble for yourself, straniera.
attributes.name: Pensive Hitman

attributes.content: What a coincidence. The thing I'm second best at is making trouble for myself.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: By the way, the thing I'm best at... is getting rid of those troubles~
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: You're in Siracusa now.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: So what?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: So that means you have no idea what you're getting yourself into.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Watch out, Exusiai!
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Attacking civilians! Which famiglia are you with?
Have you forgotten our ironclad laws?
Ugh... Talk about bad timing...
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: No wonder this little runt kept running toward Lavinia's commute.
attributes.name: Pensive Hitman

attributes.content: Let's get outta here.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Get back here!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Judge Lavinia!
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: I remember you. You're from il Ministero dei Lavori Pubblici... What's going on?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: I-I have no idea! I was just heading to work!
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: From the way those guys were dressed up, they should've known the rules. Then, why...
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: I'm just a law-abiding citizen. I've never even gotten mixed up with any of the famiglie! Why, why are they still...
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: Your Honor, don't you think there's been something weird in the air recently?
attributes.name: Clerk

attributes.content: Are the three of you alright?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: I'm fine, but those guys ended up getting away...
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Heh, I never expected Siracusa's customs to be so cutthroat.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Foreigners in Siracusa should try to be a bit more careful.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: And who might you be?
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: I am Lavinia, a judge for this city. What about you?
attributes.name: Lavinia
Exusiai
attributes.content: You can call me Exusiai. And she's Sora.

attributes.name: Exusiai
attributes.content: And that's Croissant over there.
First of all, I would like to thank you. Your brave actions saved the life of this innocent civilian.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Need my help chasing those guys down?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Don't bother. They know this city like the backs of their hands, and you won't ever catch them. I'll sort out the rest.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Where are you from?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: We came from Lungmen.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Might as well give you our business card. If'n ya ever need somethin' delivered, you give us a holler~
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Lungmen, Penguin Logistics... You're with a logistics company?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: That's right! No matter what it is, a tiny coin or a big ol' burdenbeast, we can take it wherever you need it to go!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Day or night, rain or shine, the customer's satisfaction is our mission!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Oh, assuming you have the money to pay, that is!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: ...Pfft.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Huh? Is our pitch that funny?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: No, I'm sorry. I've just been a bit on edge lately.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Did you come to Volsinii to expand your business, or just for pleasure?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Either way, you chose an unfortunate time to come.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Well, actually, we came lookin' fer a friend of ours...
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Lavinia, we're about to enjoy a grand celebration. What better time could there be to visit?
A new city is about to be born in Volsiniiâ€”the greatest event in the history of Siracusa.
Should they be lucky enough, our new friends may get to witness its birth.
...Bernardo.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Don't worry. These are my guests.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Yours? Or your troupe's?
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Which would you prefer?
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: I hope... it's neither.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: That's too bad then, because the answer is both.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: It's not too late to go back to Lungmen right now, Exusiai.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Whaddya mean?
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: You always get the wrong idea about me, Lavinia.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: I wasn't even the one who invited them here. Signorina Sora chose to come to Volsinii herself. Isn't that right?
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Yessir. In fact, I'm grateful to Compagnia dell'alba for being willing to take me.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Alright then. Since you're Signor Bernardo's... guests, you won't have to worry much about your safety, at the very least.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Just, please contact me if you need something, alright? My number's right here.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Can do~
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Now then, I need to ask this gentleman about what happened to him. The rest of you... enjoy your chat.
attributes.name: Lavinia

attributes.content: Bernardo... Bernardo... Oh!!
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: Wait, are you the Bernardo, artistic director of Compagnia dell'alba?
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: That I am.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Oh wow... You came all the way out here just for us...
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: I've always chosen actors myself. After all, you know what they say about wanting a job done well.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: And, who might these two be?
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: They're my good friends who came to Siracusa with me.
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: We're her bodyguards, too. The name's Croissant.
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: And you can just call me Exusiai.
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Very interesting names.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Shouldn't we be... moseyin' along?
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: There's no need. The famiglia associates don't cause trouble without reason. I'm not sure what kind of mess that clerk got himself into, but Siracusa is not without its own order.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: This ain't your typical 'order' now, is it?
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: You think so? I got the impression our Sankta friend here would be quite familiar with it.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Nah, even in Laterano, something like that would've been considered straight-up assault!
attributes.name: Exusiai

attributes.content: Hah, the Signora of Siracusa always says she brought 'guns and order' from Laterano, but the reality seems to be a bit different.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: The customs here might be a bit too extreme for outsiders. But, if you plan on spending any amount of time here, you'll want to get used to them as quickly as possible.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Setting aside the little intermezzo we just enjoyed, Signorina Sora, is now a good time to discuss your new job?
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Oh, of course!
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: I'm assuming you haven't read the script yet, correct? This is our troupe's latest masterpiece, and your role is found within.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: I-It would be an honor...
attributes.name: Sora

attributes.content: We haven't finalized the title of this production yet, but the name our creative team has chosen for this tragedy in three acts isâ€”
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: 'La Morte di Texas.'
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Wh-What did you just say?
attributes.name: Croissant

attributes.content: Oh? Seems my play has already captured your attention. Let's take our time and talk.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Oh right, I almost forgot in all the commotion just now.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Benvenuti in Siracusa, mie amiche.
attributes.name: Bernardo

attributes.content: Grr... It just had to be Lavinia again. Rotten luck.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: And there was that Sankta too. Why the hell would a bunch of foreigners just show up in Siracusa, at a time like this? Plus, she had some real skills too...
attributes.name: Pensive Hitman

attributes.content: Think it might be true that Signora Sicilia's guy might already be in Volsinii?
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Ugh, who cares. Let's head back and thenâ€”
attributes.name: Pensive Hitman

attributes.content: Who's there?
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Relax, paesani. I ain't your enemy.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Who do you belong to?
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Hmm... If I had to say, I s'pose I'd call myself a Sicilian.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: A Sicilian? Stop joking around. They got rubbed out ages ago.
attributes.name: Pensive Hitman

attributes.content: Is that so?
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: I don't have the energy to waste my breath on you, so get outta my way, unless you got a death wish.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: I'm just here to remind you there are people from the court waitin' in ambush over there. Steer clear, if you know what's good for you.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Who the hell are you? I never heard nothin' about nobody coming to talk to us.
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Course you didn't. Because I didn't come here to talk to you.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: That brings me to the second thing I'd like to remind you ofâ€”
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: The Sicilians may have been erased, but they didn't die out.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Whatâ€”
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: Urk... Guh...
attributes.name: Calm Hitman

attributes.content: By the way, we came here to silence you.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: You talk too damn much. Hope Lappland's not rubbing off on you.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: That, we can agree on.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Hey, it's me. We're done here.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Stay in place and wait?
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Grr, you're the boss. Ain't like I got a choice.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Looks like we chose the wrong day to come back.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Why do you say that?
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Rain.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: I hate the rain more than anything.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: It's the rainy season. I already told you before we came back.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Now that you don't have your little brother trimming your fur for you, I think you oughta go across the street right now and get it all shaved off.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Watch it, or that mop's gonna come right off your scalp.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: I actually was considering it myself, but my barber talked me out of it. Said my head's lopsided, I'd look ugly.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: But, I gotta hand it to you for findin' a way to make money so quick.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Hmph. Looks like you spent too much time in Lungmen, Capone.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: That Lin fella, sure he's got a few tricks up his sleeve and all, but doesn't Lungmen's governor have him pinned down pretty good?
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: But this is Siracusa. And here, the famiglie run the show.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: It's easy to find an odd job or two.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: With so many famiglie running around, everyone always needs some capable hands.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Alright, maybe I was in Lungmen too long, but what really surprises me is how they're still running the same playbook they used to when I left Siracusa.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: The famiglie control everything in this city from the shadows, but they never walk out onto the stage.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Why do you say that?
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: A new city is about to be born. On the surface, they're in the middle of voting for its administrator.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: But the truth is, the famiglie backing these people are constantly jockeying for power.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: What the hell are you even talking about? If we didn't lose our own city, we'd be doin' the same exact thing.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: I've been away from Siracusa for a long time, Gambino. Was it eight years? Ten?
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: That's a drop in the bucket. What's gonna change in that amount of time?
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: It's long enough to change the way I see a lotta things, but clearly not long enough to fix your shortsightedness.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: You know, it ain't like we came to no peace agreement, you and me. Our work just isn't done yet.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: If you're so eager to die, I'm glad to send you on your way.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: How can you be sure that you won't be the one dying?
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Hah...
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Bodyguard

attributes.content: How'd you know...?
attributes.name: Bodyguard

attributes.content: Bartender, get your ass out here!
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: I didn't think the two of you were on such good terms.
attributes.name: Bartender

attributes.content: Haha, looks like your patron ain't as reliable as you thought, Gambino.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Let's be clear here. As long as the two of you complete my commission, I naturally will not mistreat you.
attributes.name: Bartender

attributes.content: However, the commission is not yet complete.
attributes.name: Bartender

attributes.content: You think you can double-cross me?!
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Double-cross? If this is your idea of a double-cross, then I recommend you open your eyes a bit wider, Sicilian.
attributes.name: Bartender

attributes.content: So, where does that put us now?
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: I need to see what you two are capable ofâ€”right here, right now. It's that simple.
attributes.name: Bartender

attributes.content: As long as you walk out of this alley alive, you pass.
attributes.name: Bartender

attributes.content: I thought you were gonna say you'd take both of us at once.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Haha, my brothers would rake me over the coals for that one. 'You weren't going to let anyone pass in the first place,' or something like that.
attributes.name: Bartender

attributes.content: You sure talk a big game.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: I'm looking forward to meeting both of you again.
attributes.name: Bartender

attributes.content: Pretentious bastard. Thinks he's human just because he got used to the city.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Hah... It's been a while since I've heard that.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Looks like we don't have a choice.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: I'll make sure he figures out who doesn't have a choice.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Heh. If I knew I'd be fighting for my life back in Siracusa, I would've just stayed home.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Was that your call to make?
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Alright, fine. If we didn't show up, we probably would've been turned into mille-feuille within a day.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: But we followed her here, and she went and disappeared without a word.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: As if she was saying, 'I brought you back home. Now you're free to do whatever you want, go fend for yourselves.'
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: The moment you start thinking that is when she pops up right in front of you. You've jinxed it.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: You look like you got used to life here as well.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: She will come for us.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Lemme ask you this. In Siracusa, who's in bigger dangerâ€”a wolf who leaves the pack and goes rogue, or two strays?
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Well that's new. Never thought you'd fess up to being a stray mutt.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: I ain't dumb enough to act like I ain't lost everything.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Wish you'd admitted it sooner.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Still, it's pretty obvious that she's tryin' to play with fire right under Signora Sicilia's nose.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Right. We ain't even shit on the side of the road to that woman. And I won't stand for it. If I get the chance, I swear I'm gonna kill her.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: But then there's her. She doesn't even give a damn about Signora Sicilia.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: The same Signora Sicilia who sends us a letter and gets us shakin' in our boots.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: And that wasn't enough to get her back to Siracusa. But now, she's back, all over another lone wolf.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Oh, what was it that she asked again? Right, how we ended up so scared of Signora Sicilia?
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: You scared of her, Capone?
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Honestly, yeah. Nobody can really go against Signora Sicilia.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Every Siracusan's afraid of her.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: So, you wanna see how she dies?
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: I wanna see how she lives.
attributes.name: Gambino

attributes.content: Hate to admit it, but I'm with you.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: That's why we need to stay alive.
attributes.name: Capone

attributes.content: Another civil servant got attacked? And a Bellone associate to boot?
attributes.name: Radical Mafioso

attributes.content: Yeah, someone's clearly trying to pick a fight.
attributes.name: Loyal Mafioso

attributes.content: Hah, serves 'em right. If you ask me, it's probably the Rossatis behind it. Those scumbags and their bag of petty tricks. Disgusting.
attributes.name: Radical Mafioso

attributes.content: But, a lot of the Dodici Famiglie have already said they support the Bellones taking over the new city.
attributes.name: Skeptical Mafioso

attributes.content: So what's the point of pulling a stunt like this now?
attributes.name: Skeptical Mafioso

attributes.content: Hmph, hard to say. The Don's son, Leontuzzo, is now a secretary at il Ministero dei Lavori Pubblici.
attributes.name: Radical Mafioso

attributes.content: If someone has the skills to take him out along with il Ministro himself, wouldn't that blow things wide open again?
attributes.name: Radical Mafioso

attributes.content: Considering that runt's dumb enough to set his own famiglia aside to be a yes-man for the government.
attributes.name: Radical Mafioso

attributes.content: You say that, but are you forgetting how many associates ate shit over the last two years because they underestimated him? Oh, I almost forgot, you were one of them.
attributes.name: Skeptical Mafioso

attributes.content: Bah. I'll admit, the runt's got some talent, but that's only because the don's been sitting on his hands the whole time! Once he decides to call the shots...
attributes.name: Radical Mafioso

attributes.content: That's true. The don hasn't said anything yet, and the Bellones can't name themselves the winners so soon.
attributes.name: Loyal Mafioso

attributes.content: Enough.
The entire room suddenly falls silent, the clamor and chatter from before seeming like nothing more than an illusion.
I don't care what you believe deep down, but during this tense time, you don't make light of the situation, and you don't do anything rash.
I know what you're all thinking. I get it.
Of the Dodici Famiglie, only our Famiglia Saluzzo hasn't yet placed our wager.
It is still too soon for that.
Yes, Don Alberto.
attributes.name: Mafiosi

attributes.content: Since time immemorial, Famiglia Saluzzo has always been like this.
One is allowed to think, but not to advise. Because Alberto Saluzzo calls all the shots.
Alberto never allows anyone to question his decisions.
Nobody in the famiglia finds this unusual. They say that the Saluzzos' strength comes from the fact that Alberto is always correct.
Everyone's here? My, now that I look closely, I see a lot of old faces.
You... You're...
attributes.name: Radical Mafioso

attributes.content: But, that is not to say that there are no rebels. Only, most of them have been erased from the famiglia.
And were never heard from again.
With the exception of a white wolf named Lappland.
She pulls a chair over and props her feet up on the table, as if she owns the place.
Who let her in?
attributes.name: Alberto

attributes.content: Don Alberto, sh-she killed everyone outside and forced her way in...
attributes.name: Saluzzo Guard

attributes.content: This is a famiglia meeting. Get her out of here.
attributes.name: Alberto

attributes.content: Signorina, I mean, Lappland... The Don has asked you to leave.
attributes.name: Loyal Mafioso

attributes.content: I turned down Signora Sicilia's lunch invitation and rushed back like a good little fowlbeast, eager to return to its nest.
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: This hideout we have in Volsinii... it's kinda drab, compared to the old Saluzzo stronghold.
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: Tony, do you really have to treat me so cold?
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: You're no longer an associate of this famiglia.
attributes.name: Loyal Mafioso

attributes.content: What, you think I came back to beg the old man to let me back into this damnedâ€”I mean, this most distinguished famiglia?
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: Please watch your words, signorina.
attributes.name: Loyal Mafioso

attributes.content: Right, right. Even though I was so disgracefully kicked out, this famiglia has always had a special place in my heart.
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: So, at this critically important time, I have chosen to come back home, at risk to my own life, ignoring my father's disdainful glare, to bring back a vital piece of intelligence.
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: Does that not move you to tears?
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: Lappland... Even if you are the Don's own daughter, you've overstepped your bounds.
attributes.name: Skeptical Mafioso

attributes.content: This is no place for you to run roughshod...
attributes.name: Skeptical Mafioso

attributes.content: You... Nngh... Urgh...
attributes.name: Skeptical Mafioso

attributes.content: Never seen that guy before. Was he new?
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: Y-Yes! S-Signorina Lappland.
attributes.name: Radical Mafioso

attributes.content: You're so cruel, Father, to doubt the sincerity of my actions.
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: You got my desk dirty, Lappland.
attributes.name: Alberto

attributes.content: Desks can be replaced, right?
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: Let's hear it then. Your so-called 'vital intelligence.'
attributes.name: Alberto

attributes.content: Texas.
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: The same Texas you let go?
attributes.name: Alberto

attributes.content: That's right. Bellone brought her back.
attributes.name: Lappland

attributes.content: Lappland squints at her father.
This homecoming has not inspired a single shred of emotion within her.
She carries with her only a faint glimmer of amusement as to what might happen. Or rather, what she is about to make happen.
Because, she has been in such environments far too many times in her life.
She has returned.
The thoughts that inadvertently bubble up in her mind seem ever so laughable.
Celliâ€”â€”
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Just call me Texas.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Alright, Texas. How does it feel to be back in Siracusa?
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Not too great.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: I can imagine. If I were you, I wouldn't feel too great about suddenly being forced to go somewhere, even if it was my homeland.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Though, if this isn't too much to ask, I'd like you to imagine this as well: your father suddenly forced a 'bodyguard' onto you, and she's a whole lot stronger than you. That's not a great feeling either.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Understandable.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: That's what I wanted to hear.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Unfortunately, I don't have the power to let you leave.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: All I can say is, I hope we can both do what we need to do.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Go ahead and get changed. We had this outfit custom-tailored in old Famiglia Texas style. I hope you can be my bodyguard tonight and accompany me to the banquet.
attributes.name: Leontuzzo

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Texas

attributes.content: Beside Texas lies the well-pressed suit that Famiglia Bellone has prepared for her.
She looks toward the tightly-shut door.
She knows what she is supposed to do.
To fulfill Zaaro's contract, she needs to exit this room, kill a few irrelevant people, create some chaos, and then finally, kill a few important people.
Irrelevant, or important. This is the attitude Siracusans have toward life.
She, too, used to think like that.
Even now that she has learned to see the world through a different lens, as soon as she stepped back into this city, she quickly realized that these practices were still ever so familiar to her.
She has returned.
The thoughts that inadvertently bubble up in her mind fill her with disgust.
